did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY

persname.normal: [give the MARC presentation of creator here, i.e., surname first; include dates]

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: A small collections of letters home by Ray S. Banks dating from 1909-1910, written while he was a student at the New York State Veterinary College in Ithaca, New York.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Ray Steere Banks was born August 30, 1889 in Edmeston, New York, and raised in New Berlin, New York. His father was Charles L. Banks and his mother was Jessie Blanch Steere Banks. He came to Cornell in 1908 and graduated with a DVM degree with the Class of 1911. He became a supervising veterinarian at the New York State Department of Agriculture and Markets, where he served for nearly 25 years. He died August 19, 1957.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: A small collections of letters home by Ray S. Banks dating from 1909-1910, written while he was a student at the New York State College of Veterinary Medicine, Cornell University, Ithaca, New York.
